topic.title: Extended TestWellAction node with region property monitoring

body.p: New fields have been added to the TestWellAction node. This node checks whether closed wells can flow and opens them if so. The frequency of those tests is controlled by the TestingTimeInterval field. To be more representative of field operations, you can now restrict the triggering of these tests by monitoring region property changes around selected wells using the RegionProperty, RegionChange, and RegionTolerance fields. You can choose the type of region used to monitor those changes in a similar way to the create_regions_around_wells() command from the RegionMgr node, which means that hop-based regions, distance-based regions, and flow-based regions are supported. Using region property monitoring with TestWellAction is restricted to wells and cannot be use with completions. The RegionChange field enables the tracking of negative change, positive change, or changes in any direction in the region property.

You can use this functionality to avoid testing wells that are intermittently opened and immediately shut owing to economic actions (or pressure limit shut-offs) that cause significant intermittent flows in the simulation and, in certain cases, performance degradation.

fig.title: Well-based regions to capture and track regional properties (such as pressure or saturation) before deciding to test a well for flow
